Suppose \(k=1,...,T\) indexes time since initiating treatment. general, \(t=j+k-1\), interested set \((j,k)\) \(1 \leq t \leq T\). example, \(t=3\) comprises: patients third timestep treatment began timestep 1: (j,k)=(1,3); patients second timestep treatment began timestep 2, (j,k)=(2,2); patients first timestep treatment began timestep 3, (j,k)=(3,1) Present Value cashflow \(p_k\) \(u_j\) patients began treatment time \(j\) \(k\)th timestep treatment follows $$PV(j,k,l) = u_j \cdot p_k \cdot R_{j+k+l-1} \cdot (1+)^{2-j-k}$$ \(\) risk-free discount rate per timestep, \(p_k\) cashflow amount today’s money, \(p_k \cdot R_{j+k+l-1}\) nominal amount cashflow time incurred, allowing offset \(l = tzero\). total present value, \(TPV(l)\), therefore sum \(j\) \(k\) within time horizon \(T\), namely: $$TPV(l) = \sum_{j=1}^{T} \sum_{k=1}^{T-j+1} PV(j,k, l) \\ \; = \sum_{j=1}^{T} \sum_{k=1}^{T-j+1} u_j \cdot p_k \cdot R_{l+j+k-1} \cdot (1+)^{2-j-k}$$ function calculates \(PV(j,k,l)\) values \(j\), \(k\) \(l\), returns tibble.
